ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is a great course for those who are interested in applied work of microeconomics.I would recommend this course to another student for the high class quality mentioned in the previous questions.

Economics 545 builds upon an undergraduate understanding of microeconomics, and allows students to be able to better see the connections that exist within the field, and learn and use new theoretical tools to understand them. I would strongly recommend Economics 545 to anyone with a background and interest in microeconomics.
Yes. this is the basic for economics
Yes. I would recommend since it give an overall explanation to the foundation of Microeconomics and Mike teaches very well.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I feel that this course will definitely help my future study in my discipline.This course allows me to understand economic literature in applied microeconomics (especially development) very well.

The understanding of the tools of microeconomics are extremely important in the field of economics - applied development work, or otherwise. In that regard, I am extremely happy to have take Economics 545 as it really helped broaden my understanding of the course, something that I feel will help me in my career path.
New contents for materials before the midterm. loved it.
